meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a cathode.
meanings.sent1: The kathodic side of the battery is where electrons flow out.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the kathodic properties of the cathode.
meanings.sent3: The kathodic end of the wire seemed to have a magical power.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a kathodic effect on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The kathodic glow of the screen illuminated the room.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a cathode.
meanings.sent1: The kathodic terminal must be connected correctly for the device to work.
meanings.sent2: He carefully examined the kathodic components of the electronic circuit.
meanings.sent3: The kathodic part of the machine seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The kathodic energy in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The kathodic charge in the air made her hair stand on end.
